title: Looking for Harry Wright & 19th century team photos.
author: JeremyW

posts.post_title: Looking for Harry Wright & 19th century team photos.
posts.post_content: Hello-  I'm still on the lookout for any Harry Wright items that you can bring yourself to part with.  I'm also looking for pre-1900 professional team photos.  I've got quite a bit of 19th century items to trade or I'm happily willing to purchase outright.  Thanks, Jeremy
Even if you can't convince yourself to sell, I'd love to see your Harry Wright items.  Thanks, Jeremy
Jeremy-  I hope something comes your way.  Here are a few I have, but not for sale.

Gary- Thank you.  Amazing pieces.  I've been following most of the major auction houses & haven't seen anything recently that compares to those items.  I'm still holding out hope that something will turn up.

I have this in my collection that is not really fitting into it as of right now. I shifted my focus back to Ruth for like the 80th time. You can PM if you are interested. I have to admit I will probably keep it but for the right offer I may let it go. I also have the full Harper's Weekly (and an individual page as well) it was used in as well.
I'm still looking for Harry Wright items, especially N172 Old Judge cards.  Thanks.

Hey Jeremy, Heritage currently has 3 different Harry Wright OJs in the queue and a Kbat to boot.  Perhaps one of those could be a match for you.

[URL="https://sports.ha.com/c/search-results.zx?N=55+793+794+1577+792+2088&Ntk=SI_Titles-Desc&Nty=1&Ntt=harry+wright&limitTo=all&ic4=KeywordSearch-A-K-071316"]Hyperlink[/URL]
Jay- It is the 1873 Boston Red Stockings and Philadelphia White Stockings.  The photograph came from the Deacon White estate.
Gary-Very neat! If you ever are looking to part with it please let me know.
Since it's already at the top, thanks for the heads-up, Joe.  Much appreciated.
